abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth Support
            Palestinian National Development Plan Program Project for
            West Bank and Gaza were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            program design needs to be realistic, taking into account
            the political economy, the context of fragility, technical
            and other relevant challenges and risks. Specifically the
            technical challenges of implementing specific reforms ought
            to be taken into account in operation design. The reform
            aimed at introducing a payroll system in two ministries on
            pilot basis was not implemented as intended. This was
            evidently not due to inadequate ownership on the
            government's side, but rather because of the technical
            challenge of implementing the reform within a given
            timeframe turned insurmountable. Future operations should
            assess not only the readiness to implement particular
            reforms, but also the technical feasibility, when proposed
            reforms have to undergo an implementation process that may
            be technically challenging. Single tranche operations can
            and should be designed with a medium-term agenda in mind
            whenever possible. While it will probably not be appropriate
            to design a programmatic DPG, given the high level of
            uncertainty in West Bank and Gaza, this operation was
            designed with some medium term objectives in mind and has
            been successfully used as a platform to support the dialogue
            with the authorities on the medium term program, even when
            the implementation of some of its actions had to be
            postponed. Finally, the medium term outlook has been a
            useful tool in the preparation of a follow up operation.
